intro: Bifrenaria leucorrhoda var. macaheensis, commonly known as the Macahe Mountain orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species found in specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive white or pale pink lip. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories where it relies on specific mycorrhizal associations for nutrient uptake. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, this variety is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
